IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDesc: A GENEROUS GIFT OF $1,000,000 BY CHARLOTTE COLBY DANLY, HERSELF A GRADUATE OF LYME ACADEMY, ENABLED A SEARCH FOR A TEACHER TO CARRY FORWARD THE ACADEMYS DISTINGUISHED TRADITION IN THE FIELD OF SCULPTURE. A SEARCH COMMITTEE WAS FORMED TO CARRY OUT THE SEARCH, COMPRISED OF: MS. DANLY; BOARD MEMBER/ARTIST EILEEN EDER; BOARD CHAIR MICHAEL DUFFY; JORDAN SOKOL; ISRAELI SCULPTOR ERAN WEBER; AND THE FORMER HEAD OF THE SCULPTURE DEPARTMENT AT THE FLORENCE ACADEMY, ROBERT BODEM. AFTER REVIEWING A RICH POOL OF APPLICANTS, THE COMMITTEE UNANIMOUSLY CHOSE ACCLAIMED SCULPTOR CHAD FISHER TO BE THE CHARLOTTE COLBY DANLY SCULPTURE CHAIR AT LYME ACADEMY. THE FIRST COHORT OF FULL-TIME SCULPTURE STUDENTS COMMENCED THEIR STUDIES IN THE FALL OF 2023 UNDER MR. FISHERS TUTELAGE. IN MARCH OF 2023, THE ACADEMY HIRED A MANAGING DIRECTOR, WENDY BURY, TO BE RESPONSIBLE FOR OVERSEEING THE DAILY OPERATIONS, AS WELL AS FOR STRATEGIC PLANNING INITIATIVES, COMMUNITY OUTREACH AND INSTITUTIONAL DEVELOPMENT, AS THE ACADEM
IRS990.MissionDesc: THE MISSION OF THE LYME ACADEMY OF FINE ARTS IS TO TEACH THE FOUNDATIONAL SKILLS OF DRAWING, PAINTING, AND SCULPTURE IN THE FIGURATIVE TRADITION. BY ITS COMMITMENT TO TRAINING STUDENTS IN THESE SKILLS AND AN ENGAGEMENT WITH CONTEMPORARY DISCOURSE, THE ACADEMY WILL EMPOWER A NEW GENERATION OF ARTISTS. THROUGH ITS PROGRAMS, THE ACADEMY IS COMMITTED TO ENRICHING THE CULTURAL LIFE OF THE COMMUNITY.
IRS990.Desc: THE LYME ACADEMY HAS RETURNED TO ITS FOUNDING PRINCIPLES UNDER THE LEADERSHIP OF ARTISTIC DIRECTORS JORDAN SOKOL AND AMAYA GURPIDE. THIS HUSBAND-AND-WIFE TEAM OF ARTISTS HARKEN BACK TO THE ACADEMY'S FOUNDING LEADERS, SCULPTOR ELISABETH GORDON CHANDLER AND HER HUSBAND, RENOWNED ARTIST LACI DEGERENDAY. THE CLARITY OF THE VISION ARTICULATED BY MR. SOKOL AND MS. GURPIDE HAS ATTRACTED A GROWING NUMBER OF STUDENTS AND ARTISTS TO STUDY AND TEACH AT THE ACADEMY. THE LYME ACADEMY IS IN THE PROCESS OF LAUNCHING THEIR NEW SCULPTURE PROGRAM THAT WILL BE AVAILABLE IN THE FALL OF 2023.

OtherLiabilitiesOrgGrp.Desc: DUE TO UNIV OF NEW HAVEN

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Part III, Line 4: Description of organization's collections and how it furthers its purpose.
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: The Academy capitalizes works of art that it intends to maintain as part of its permanent collection. These items are recorded at their estimated fair value at the time they are donated to the Academy. The works are displayed for the general public and students who visit the campus and are also used as part of the academic programs.

The accounting standards on accounting for uncertainty in income taxes address the determination of whether tax benefits claimed or expected to be claimed on a tax return should be recorded in the financial statements. Under that guidance, the Academy may recognize the tax benefit from an uncertain tax position only if it is more likely than not that the tax position will be sustained on examination by taxing authorities based on the technical merits of the position. Examples of tax positions include the tax-exempt status of the Academy and various positions related to the potential sources of unrelated business taxable income (UBTI). The tax benefits recognized in the financial statements from a tax position are measured based on the largest benefit that has a greater than 50% likelihood of being realized upon ultimate settlement. Management has determined that the Academy does not have any uncertain tax positions and associated unrecognized tax benefits that materially impact the financial statements or related disclosures. Since tax matters are subject to some degree of uncertainty, there can be no assurance that the Academys tax positions will not be challenged by the taxing authorities.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Schedule E, Line 3 - Racially Nondiscriminatory Policy Publicized
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: NON-DISCRIMINATION POLICY: THE ACADEMY STATES THAT IT IS OPEN TO ALL PERSONS REGARDLESS OF RACE, CREED, SEX, OR NATIONAL ORIGIN WHENEVER POSSIBLE IN ITS VARIOUS CATALOGS, PUBLICATIONS AND OTHER MATERIAL.

Schedule E, Line 5 - Explanation of Organization Discrimination by Race
Form 990, Part VI, Section B, Line 11b
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: FORM 990 IS DISTRIBUTED TO THE BOARD OF TRUSTEES TO REVIEW BEFORE IT IS FILED WITH THE IRS.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, Line 12c
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE OFFICERS AND TRUSTEES ARE REQUIRED TO DISCLOSE ANY CONFLICTS OF INTEREST AT THE EARLIEST PRACTICABLE TIME. NO TRUSTEE SHALL VOTE ON ANY MATTER UNDER CONSIDERATION OF THE BOARD WHERE SUCH A CONFLICT EXISTS. ANY CONFLICTS OF INTEREST ARE REFLECTED IN THE MINUTES OF ANY BOARD OF TRUSTEES MEETINGS.
